instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD1: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD1? PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 is a power rail that powers the soldered on SSDs.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid Damage around NAND1 hits 50*C
threads.message:
Lots of liquid damage around <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> and <CHIP>U9080</CHIP>. Reballed <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> as it was badly corroded underneath.

Getting 3Ohm resistance on <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD1</SIGNAL>. 410Ohm on a same board for comparison.
Lift up L9080/1 to check if caused by <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> but there is no short on it.


<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD1</SIGNAL> - 2.5V - 3Ohm
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD1</SIGNAL> - 0.8V - 452Ohm

Internal SSD failure?
[ATTACH type="full" width="801px" alt="1670979934181.png"]60902[/ATTACH]

[ATTACH type="full" alt="1670979713510.png"]60901[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid Damage around NAND1 hits 50*C
threads.message:
Very likely.
You can try changing one chip only.
But be prepaired to change all NANDs.

Read this, may help you...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-<CHIP>U9400</CHIP>.63376/[/URL]
